word: 00055\ 55 'abak aw-bak' a primitive root; probably to coil upward:--mount up.
00056\ 56 'abal aw-bal' a primitive root; to bewail:--lament, mourn.
00058\ 58 'abel aw-bale' from an unused root (meaning to be grassy); a meadow:--plain. Compare also the proper names beginning with Abel-.
00073\ 73 'abnet ab-nate' of uncertain derivation; a belt:--girdle.
00075\ 75 'abac aw-bas' a primitive root; to fodder:--fatted, stalled.
00076\ 76 'aba`bu`ah ab-ah-boo-aw' (by reduplication) from an unused root (meaning to belch forth); an inflammatory pustule (as eruption):--blains.
00077\ 77 'Ebets eh'-bets from an unused root probably meaning to gleam; conspicuous; Ebets, a place in Palestine:--Abez.
00082\ 82 'abar aw-bar' a primitive root; to soar:--fly.
00086\ 86 'abrek ab-rake' probably an Egyptian word meaning kneel:--bow the knee.
00092\ 92 'aguddah ag-ood-daw' feminine passive participle of an unused root (meaning to bind); a band, bundle, knot, or arch:--bunch, burden, troop.
00093\ 93 'egowz eg-oze' prob of Persian origin; a nut:--nut.
00096\ 96 'egel eh'-ghel from an unused root (meaning to flow down or together as drops); a reservoir:--drop.
00098\ 98 'agam ag-am' from an unused root (meaning to collect as water); a marsh; hence a rush (as growing in swamps); hence a stockade of reeds:--pond, pool, standing (water).
00103\ 103 'agar aw-gar' a primitive root; to harvest:--gather.
00104\ 104 'iggra' ig-er-aw' (Aramaic) of Persian origin; an epistle (as carried by a state courier or postman):--letter.
00105\ 105 'agartal ag-ar-tawl' of uncertain derivation; a basin:--charger.
00109\ 109 'adab aw-dab' a primitive root; to languish:--grieve.
00112\ 112 'Iddow id-do of uncertain derivation; Iddo, an Israelite:--Iddo.

00113\ 113 'adown aw-done' or (shortened) adon {aw-done'}; from an unused root (meaning to rule); sovereign, i.e. controller (human or divine):-- lord, master, owner. Compare also names beginning with "Adoni-".
00116\ 116 'edayin ed-ah'-yin (Aramaic) of uncertain derivation; then (of time):--now, that time, then.
00118\ 118 'Adalya' ad-al-yaw' of Persian derivation; Adalja, a son of Haman:--Adalia.
00119\ 119 'adam aw-dam' to show blood (in the face), i.e. flush or turn rosy:--be (dyed, made) red (ruddy).
00133\ 133 'Admatha' ad-maw-thaw' probably of Persian derivation: Admatha, a Persian nobleman:--Admatha.
00142\ 142 'adar aw-dar' a primitive root; to expand, i.e. be great or (figuratively) magnificent:--(become) glorious, honourable.
00143\ 143 'Adar ad-awr' probably of foreign derivation; perhaps meaning fire; Adar, the 12th Hebrew month:--Adar.
00149\ 149 'adrazda' ad-raz-daw' (Aramaic) probably of Persian origin; quickly or carefully:--diligently.
00150\ 150 'adarkon ad-ar-kone' of Persian origin; a daric or Persian coin:--dram.
00156\ 156 'adash aw-dash' a primitive root; to tread out (grain):--thresh.
00157\ 157 'ahab aw-hab' or raheb {aw-habe'}; a primitive root; to have affection for (sexually or otherwise):--(be-)love(-d, -ly, -r), like, friend.
00161\ 161 'Ohad o'-had from an unused root meaning to be united; unity; Ohad, an Israelite:--Ohad.
00162\ 162 'ahahh a-haw' apparently a primitive word expressing pain exclamatorily; Oh!:--ah, alas.
00163\ 163 'Ahava' a-hav-aw' probably of foreign origin; Ahava, a river of Babylonia:--Ahava.
00166\ 166 'ahal aw-hal' a primitive root; to be clear:--shine.
00174\ 174 'ahaliym a-haw-leem' or (feminine) ahalowth {a-haw-loth'} (only used thus in the plural); of foreign origin; aloe wood (i.e. sticks):--(tree of lign-) aloes.
00175\ 175 'Aharown a-har-one' of uncertain derivation; Aharon, the brother of Moses:--Aaron.
00181\ 181 'uwd ood from an unused root meaning to rake together; a poker (for turning or gathering embers):--(fire-)brand.
00183\ 183 'avah aw-vaw' a primitive root; to wish for:--covet, (greatly) desire, be desirous, long, lust (after).
00184\ 184 'avah aw-vaw' a primitive root; to extend or mark out:--point out.
00187\ 187 'Uwzal oo-zawl' of uncertain derivation; Uzal, a son of Joktan:--Uzal.
00191\ 191 'eviyl ev-eel' from an unused root (meaning to be perverse); (figuratively) silly:--fool(-ish) (man).
00192\ 192 'Eviyl Mrodak ev-eel' mer-o-dak' of Aramaic derivation and probably meaning soldier of Merodak; Evil-Merodak, a Babylonian king:--Evil-merodach.
00193\ 193 'uwl ool from an unused root meaning to twist, i.e. (by implication) be strong; the body (as being rolled together); also powerful:--mighty, strength.
00195\ 195 'Uwlay oo-lah'ee of Persian derivation; the Ulai (or Eulaeus), a river of Persia:--Ulai.
00204\ 204 'Own one or (shortened); On {one}; of Egyptian derivation; On, a city of Egypt:--On.
00211\ 211 'Owphiyr o-feer' or (shortened) pOphiyr {o-feer'}; and fOwphir {o- feer'}; of uncertain derivation; Ophir, the name of a son of Joktan, and of a gold region in the East:--Ophir.
00212\ 212 'owphan o-fawn' or (shortened) pophan {o-fawn'}; from an unused root meaning to revolve; a wheel:--wheel.
00213\ 213 'uwts oots a primitive root; to press; (by implication) to be close, hurry, withdraw:--(make) haste(-n, -y), labor, be narrow.
00215\ 215 'owr ore a primitive root; to be (causative, make) luminous (literally and metaphorically):--X break of day, glorious, kindle, (be, en-, give, show) light (-en, -ened), set on fire, shine.
00225\ 225 'uwth ooth a primitive root; properly, to come, i.e. (implied) to assent:--consent.
00227\ 227 'az awz a demonstrative adverb; at that time or place; also as a conjunction, therefore:--beginning, for, from, hitherto, now, of old, once, since, then, at which time, yet.
00228\ 228 'aza' az-zaw' (Aramaic) or iazah (Aramaic) {az-aw'}; to kindle; (by implication) to heat:--heat, hot.
00230\ 230 'azad az-zawd' (Aramaic) of uncertain derivation; firm:--be gone.
00231\ 231 'ezowb ay-zobe' probably of foreign derivation; hyssop:--hyssop.

00235\ 235 'azal aw-zal' a primitive root; to go away, hence, to disappear:--fail, gad about, go to and fro (but in Ezek. 27:19 the word is rendered by many "from Uzal," by others "yarn"), be gone (spent).
00247\ 247 'azar aw-zar' a primitive root; to belt:--bind (compass) about, gird (up, with).
00254\ 254 'ach awkh of uncertain derivation; a fire-pot or chafing dish:-- hearth.
00258\ 258 'achad aw-khad' perhaps a primitive root; to unify, i.e. (figuratively) collect (one's thoughts):--go one way or other.
00260\ 260 'achuw aw'-khoo of uncertain (perhaps Egyptian) derivation; a bulrush or any marshy grass (particularly that along the Nile):--flag, meadow.

00270\ 270 'achaz aw-khaz' a primitive root; to seize (often with the accessory idea of holding in possession):--+ be affrighted, bar, (catch, lay, take) hold (back), come upon, fasten, handle, portion, (get, have or take) possess(-ion).
00307\ 307 'Achmtha' akh-me-thaw' of Persian derivation; Achmetha (i.e. Ecbatana), the summer capital of Persia:--Achmetha.
00308\ 308 'Achacbay akh-as-bah'ee of uncertain derivation; Achasbai, an Israelite:--Ahasbai.
00309\ 309 'achar aw-khar' a primitive root; to loiter (i.e. be behind); by implication to procrastinate:--continue, defer, delay, hinder, be late (slack), stay (there), tarry (longer).
00323\ 323 'achashdarpan akh-ash-dar-pan' of Persian derivation; a satrap or governor of a main province (of Persia):--lieutenant.

00325\ 325 'Achashverowsh akh-ash-vay-rosh' or (shortened) pAchashrosh {akh- ash-rosh'} (Esth. 10:1); of Persian origin; Achashverosh (i.e. Ahasuerus or Artaxerxes, but in this case Xerxes), the title (rather than name) of a Persian king:--Ahasuerus.
00326\ 326 'achashtariy akh-ash-taw-ree' probably of Persian derivation; an achastarite (i.e. courier); the designation (rather than name) of an Israelite:--Haakashtari (includ. the article).
00327\ 327 'achastaran akh-ash-taw-rawn' of Persian origin; a mule:--camel.
00328\ 328 'at at from an unused root perhaps meaning to move softly; (as a noun) a necromancer (from their soft incantations), (as an adverb) gently:--charmer, gently, secret, softly.
00329\ 329 'atad aw-tawd' from an unused root probably meaning to pierce or make fast; a thorn-tree (especially the buckthorn):--Atad, bramble, thorn.
00330\ 330 'etuwn ay-toon' from an unused root (probably meaning to bind); properly, twisted (yarn), i.e. tapestry:--fine linen.
00331\ 331 'atam aw-tam' a primitive root; to close (the lips or ears); by analology to contract (a window by bevelled jambs):--narrow, shut, stop.
00332\ 332 'atar aw-tar' a primitive root; to close up:--shut.
00340\ 340 'ayab aw-yab' a primitive root; to hate (as one of an opposite tribe or party); hence to be hostile:--be an enemy.
00366\ 366 'ayom aw-yome' from an unused root (meaning to frighten); frightful:--terrible.
00374\ 374 'eyphah ay-faw' or (shortened) ephah {ay-faw'}; of Egyptian derivation; an ephah or measure for grain; hence, a measure in general:-- ephah, (divers) measure(-s).

00386\ 386 'eythan ay-thawn' or (shortened) ethan {ay-thawn'}; from an unused root (meaning to continue); permanence; hence (concrete) permanent; specifically a chieftain:--hard, mighty, rough, strength, strong.
00390\ 390 'Akkad ak-kad' from an unused root probably meaning to strengthen; a fortress; Accad, a place in Babylon:--Accad.
00393\ 393 'akzar ak-zawr' from an unused root (apparently meaning to act harshly); violent; by implication deadly; also (in a good sense) brave:--cruel, fierce.
00397\ 397 'Akiysh aw-keesh' of uncertain derivation; Akish, a Philistine king:--Achish.

00398\ 398 'akal aw-kal' a primitive root; to eat (literally or figuratively):--X at all, burn up, consume, devour(-er, up), dine, eat(-er, up), feed (with), food, X freely, X in...wise(-deed, plenty), (lay) meat, X quite.
00404\ 404 'akaph aw-kaf' a primitive root; apparently meaning to curve (as with a burden); to urge:--crave.
00406\ 406 'ikkar ik-kawr' from an unused root meaning to dig; a farmer:--husbandman, ploughman.

00413\ 413 'el ale (but only used in the shortened constructive form sel {el}); a primitive particle; properly, denoting motion towards, but occasionally used of a quiescent position, i.e. near, with or among; often in general, to:--about, according to ,after, against, among, as for, at, because(-fore, -side), both...and, by, concerning, for, from, X hath, in(- to), near, (out) of, over, through, to(-ward), under, unto, upon, whether, with(-in).
00422\ 422 'alah aw-law' a primitive root; properly, to adjure, i.e. (usually in a bad sense) imprecate:--adjure, curse, swear.
00433\ 433 'elowahh el-o'-ah; rarely (shortened) >eloahh {el-o'-ah probably prolonged (emphat.) from 410; a deity or the Deity:--God, god. See 430. see HEBREW for 0410 see HEBREW for 0430
00435\ 435 'Eluwl el-ool' probably of foreign derivation; Elul, the sixth Jewish month:--Elul.
00442\ 442 'Aluwsh aw-loosh' of uncertain derivation; Alush, a place in the Desert:--Alush.
00444\ 444 'alach aw-lakh' a primitive root; to muddle, i.e. (figuratively and intransitive) to turn (morally) corrupt:--become filthy.
00473\ 473 'Eliyshah el-ee-shaw' probably of foreign derivation; Elishah, a son of Javan:--Elishah.
00481\ 481 'alam aw-lam' a primitive root; to tie fast; hence (of the mouth) to be tongue-tied:--bind, be dumb, put to silence.
00486\ 486 'Almowdad al-mo-dawd' probably of foreign derivation:--Almodad, a son of Joktan:--Almodad.
00495\ 495 'Ellacar el-law-sawr' probably of foreign derivation; Ellasar, an early country of Asia:--Ellasar.
00502\ 502 'alph aw-lof' a primitive root, to associate with; hence, to learn (and causatively to teach):--learn, teach, utter.
00509\ 509 'alats aw-lats' a primitive root; to press:--urge.
00512\ 512 'Elqoshiy el-ko-shee' patrial from a name of uncertain derivation; an Elkoshite or native of Elkosh:--Elkoshite.
00514\ 514 'Eltqe el-te-kay' or (more properly) nEltqeh {el-te-kay'}; of uncertain derivation; Eltekeh or Elteke, a place in Palestine:-- Eltekeh.
seeing, since, sith, + surely (no more, none, not), though, + of a truth, + unless, + verily, when, whereas, whether, while, + yet.
00519\ 519 'amah aw-maw' apparently a primitive word; a maid-servant or female slave:--(hand-)bondmaid(-woman), maid(-servant).

00530\ 530 'emuwnah em-oo-naw'); or (shortened) >emunah {em-oo-naw' feminine of 529; literally firmness; figuratively security; morally fidelity:--faith(-ful, -ly, -ness, (man)), set office, stability, steady, truly, truth, verily. see HEBREW for 0529
00535\ 535 'amal aw-mal' a primitive root; to droop; by implication to be sick, to mourn:--languish, be weak, wax feeble.

00553\ 553 'amats aw-mats' a primitive root; to be alert, physically (on foot) or mentally (in courage):--confirm, be courageous (of good courage, stedfastly minded, strong, stronger), establish, fortify, harden, increase, prevail, strengthen (self), make strong (obstinate, speed).

00559\ 559 'amar aw-mar' a primitive root; to say (used with great latitude):--answer, appoint, avouch, bid, boast self, call, certify, challenge, charge, + (at the, give) command(-ment), commune, consider, declare, demand, X desire, determine, X expressly, X indeed, X intend, name, X plainly, promise, publish, report, require, say, speak (against, of), X still, X suppose, talk, tell, term, X that is, X think, use (speech), utter, X verily, X yet.
00569\ 569 'Amraphel am-raw-fel' of uncertain (perhaps foreign) derivation; Amraphel, a king of Shinar:--Amraphel.
00570\ 570 'emesh eh'-mesh time past, i.e. yesterday or last night:--former time, yesterday(-night)
00578\ 578 'anah aw-naw' a primitive root; to groan:--lament, mourn.
00584\ 584 'anach aw-nakh' a primitive root; to sigh:--groan, mourn, sigh.
00594\ 594 'anak an-awk' probably from an unused root meaning to be narrow; according to most a plumb-line, and to others a hook:--plumb-line.
00595\ 595 'anokiy aw-no-kee' sometimes {aw-no'-kee}; a primitive pro.; I:--I, me, X which.
00596\ 596 'anan aw-nan' a primitive root; to mourn, i.e. complain:--complain.
00599\ 599 'anaph aw-naf' a primitive root; to breathe hard, i.e. be enraged:--be angry (displeased).
00602\ 602 'anaq aw-nak' a primitive root; to shriek:--cry, groan.
00605\ 605 'anash aw-nash' a primitive root; to be frail, feeble, or (figuratively) melancholy:--desperate(-ly wicked), incurable, sick, woeful.
00609\ 609 'Aca' aw-saw' of uncertain derivation; Asa, the name of a king and of a Levite:--Asa.
00618\ 618 'acam aw-sawm' from an unused root meaning to heap together; a storehouse (only in the plural):--barn, storehouse.
00619\ 619 'Acnah as-naw' of uncertain derivation; Asnah, one of the Nethinim:--Asnah.
00620\ 620 'Ocnappar os-nap-par' of foreign derivation; Osnappar, an Assyrian king:--Asnapper.
00621\ 621 'Acnath aw-se-nath' of Egyptian derivation; Asenath, the wife of Joseph:--Asenath.

00622\ 622 'acaph aw-saf' a primitive root; to gather for any purpose; hence, to receive, take away, i.e. remove (destroy, leave behind, put up, restore, etc.):--assemble, bring, consume, destroy, felch, gather (in, together, up again), X generally, get (him), lose, put all together, receive, recover (another from leprosy), (be) rereward, X surely, take (away, into, up), X utterly, withdraw.
00629\ 629 'ocparna' os-par-naw' (Aramaic) of Persian derivation; diligently:--fast, forthwith, speed(-ily).
00630\ 630 'Acpatha' as-paw-thaw' of Persian derivation; Aspatha, a son of Haman:--Aspatha.

00631\ 631 'acar aw-sar' a primitive root; to yoke or hitch; by analogy, to fasten in any sense, to join battle:--bind, fast, gird, harness, hold, keep, make ready, order, prepare, prison(-er), put in bonds, set in array, tie.
00634\ 634 'Ecar-Chaddown ay-sar' Chad-dohn' of foreign derivation; Esar- chaddon, an Assyrian king:--Esar-haddon.
00635\ 635 'Ecter es-tare' of Persian derivation; Ester, the Jewish heroine:--Esther.

00637\ 637 'aph af a primitive particle; meaning accession (used as an adverb or conjunction); also or yea; adversatively though:--also, + although, and (furthermore, yet), but, even, + how much less (more, rather than), moreover, with, yea.
00643\ 643 'appeden ap-peh'-den apparently of foreign derivation; a pavilion or palace-tent:--palace.
00644\ 644 'aphah aw-faw' a primitive root; to cook, especially to bake:--bake(-r, (-meats)).
00646\ 646 'ephowd ay-fode' rarely oephod {ay-fode'}; probably of foreign derivation ; a girdle; specifically the ephod or high-priest's shoulder- piece; also generally, an image:--ephod.
00651\ 651 'aphel aw-fale' from an unused root meaning to set as the sun; dusky:--very dark.
00655\ 655 'ophen o'-fen from an unused root meaning to revolve; a turn, i.e. a season:--+ fitly.
00656\ 656 'aphec aw-face' a primitive root; to disappear, i.e. cease:--be clean gone (at an end, brought to nought), fail.
00659\ 659 'epha` eh'-fah from an unused root probably meaning to breathe; properly, a breath, i.e. nothing:--of nought.
00661\ 661 'aphaph aw-faf' a primitive root; to surround:--compass.
00662\ 662 'aphaq aw-fak' a primitive root; to contain, i.e. (reflex.) abstain:--force (oneself), restrain.
00665\ 665 'epher ay'-fer from an unused root meaning to bestrew; ashes:--ashes.
00668\ 668 'appiryown ap-pir-yone' probably of Egyptian derivation; a palanquin:--chariot.
00670\ 670 'Apharcay af-aw-re-sah'ee (Aramaic) of foreign origin (only in the plural); an Apherasite or inhabitant of an unknown region of Assyria:-- Apharsite.

00671\ 671 'Apharckay af-ar-sek-ah'ee (Aramaic) or fApharcathkay (Aramaic) {af-ar-sath-kah'ee}; of foreign origin (only in the plural); an Apharsekite or Apharsathkite, an unknown Assyrian tribe:--Apharsachites, Apharasthchites.
00674\ 674 'appthom ap-pe-thome' (Aramaic) of Persian origin; revenue; others at the last:--revenue.
00675\ 675 'Etsbown ets-bone' or mEtsbon {ets-bone'}; of uncertain derivation; Etsbon, the name of two Israelites:--Ezbon.
00684\ 684 'Otsem o'-tsem from an unused root probably meaning to be strong; strength (i.e. strong); Otsem, the name of two Israelites:--Ozem.
00686\ 686 'atsar aw-tsar' a primitive root; to store up:--(lay up in) store, + (make) treasure(-r).
00693\ 693 'arab aw-rab' a primitive root; to lurk:--(lie in) ambush(-ment), lay (lie in) wait.
00707\ 707 'arag aw-rag' a primitive root; to plait or weave:--weaver(-r).
00713\ 713 'argaman ar-gaw-mawn' of foreign origin; purple (the color or the dyed stuff):--purple.
00714\ 714 `Ard ard from an unused root probably meaning to wander; fugitive; Ard, the name of two Israelites:--Ard.
00717\ 717 'arah aw-raw' a primitive root; to pluck:--gather, pluck.

00724\ 724 'aruwkah ar-oo-kaw' or rarukah {ar-oo-kaw'}; feminine passive participle of 748 (in the sense of restoring to soundness); wholeness (literally or figuratively):--health, made up, perfected.
00732\ 732 'arach aw-rakh' a primitive root; to travel:--go, wayfaring (man).
00742\ 742 'Ariyday ar-ee-dah'-ee of Persian origin; Aridai, a son of Haman:--Aridai.
00743\ 743 'Ariydatha' ar-ee-daw-thaw' of Persian origin; Aridatha, a son of Haman:--Aridatha.
00746\ 746 'Aryowk ar-yoke' of foreign origin; Arjok, the name of two Babylonians:--Arioch.
00747\ 747 'Ariycay ar-ee-sah'-ee of Persian origin; Arisai, a son of Haman:--Arisai.
00748\ 748 'arak aw-rak' a primitive root; to be (causative, make) long (literally or figuratively):--defer, draw out, lengthen, (be, become, make, pro-)long, + (out-, over-)live, tarry (long).
00768\ 768 'arnebeth ar-neh'-beth of uncertain derivation; the hare:--hare.
00775\ 775 'Arpakshad ar-pak-shad' probably of foreign origin; Arpakshad, a son of Noah; also the region settled by him:--Arphaxad.

00776\ 776 'erets eh'-rets from an unused root probably meaning to be firm; the earth (at large, or partitively a land):--X common, country, earth, field, ground, land, X natins, way, + wilderness, world.
00779\ 779 'arar aw-rar' a primitive root; to execrate:--X bitterly curse.
00780\ 780 'Ararat ar-aw-rat' of foreign origin; Ararat (or rather Armenia):--Ararat, Armenia.
00781\ 781 'aras aw-ras' a primitive root; to engage for matrimony:--betroth, espouse.

00783\ 783 'Artachshashta' ar-takh-shash-taw' or mArtachshasht {ar-takh- shasht'}; or by permutation gArtachshactu {ar-takh-shast'}; of foreign origin; Artachshasta (or Artaxerxes), a title (rather than name) of several Persian kings:--Artaxerxes.
00784\ 784 'esh aysh a primitive word; fire (literally or figuratively):-- burning, fiery, fire, flaming, hot.
00793\ 793 'eshed eh'-shed from an unused root meaning to pour; an outpouring:--stream.
00803\ 803 'ashuwyah ash-oo-yah' feminine passive participle from an unused root meaning to found; foundation:--foundation.
00807\ 807 'Ashiyma' ash-ee-maw' of foreign origin; Ashima, a deity of Hamath:--Ashima.
00810\ 810 'eshek eh'-shek from an unused root (probably meaning to bunch together); a testicle (as a lump):--stone.
00813\ 813 'Ashknaz ash-ken-az' of foreign origin; Ashkenaz, a Japhethite, also his descendants:--Ashkenaz.
00815\ 815 'eshel ay'-shel from a root of uncertain signification; a tamarisk tree; by extension, a grove of any kind:--grove, tree.

00816\ 816 'asham aw-sham' or mashem {aw-shame'}; a primitive root; to be guilty; by implication to be punished or perish:--X certainly, be(-come, made) desolate, destroy, X greatly, be(-come, found, hold) guilty, offend (acknowledge offence), trespass.
00822\ 822 'eshnab esh-nawb' apparently from an unused root (probably meaning to leave interstices); A latticed window:--casement, lattice.
00825\ 825 'ashshaph ash-shawf' from an unused root (probably meaning to lisp, i.e. practice enchantment); a conjurer:--astrologer.
00828\ 828 'Ashpnaz ash-pen-az' of foreign origin; Ashpenaz, a Babylonian eunuch:--Ashpenaz.
00829\ 829 'eshpar esh-pawr' of uncertain derivation; a measured portion:--good piece (of flesh).

00833\ 833 'ashar aw-shar' or rasher {aw-share'}; a primitive root; to be straight (used in the widest sense, especially to be level, right, happy); figuratively, to go forward, be honest, proper:--(call, be) bless(-ed, happy), go, guide, lead, relieve.

00834\ 834 'aher ash-er' a primitive relative pronoun (of every gender and number); who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.:--X after, X alike, as (soon as), because, X every, for, + forasmuch, + from whence, + how(-soever), X if, (so) that ((thing) which, wherein), X though, + until, + whatsoever, when, where (+ -as, -in, -of, -on, -soever, -with), which, whilst, + whither(- soever), who(-m, -soever, -se). As it is indeclinable, it is often accompanied by the personal pronoun expletively, used to show the connection.
00855\ 855 'eth ayth of uncertain derivation; a hoe or other digging implement:--coulter, plowshare.
00857\ 857 'athah aw-thaw' or matha {aw-thaw'}; a primitive root (collateral to 225 contraction); to arrive:--(be-, things to) come (upon), bring.

00859\ 859 'attah at-taw' or (shortened); aatta {at-taw'}; or wath {ath}; feminine (irregular) sometimes nattiy {at-tee'}; plural masculine attem {at- tem'}; feminine atten {at-ten'}; or oattenah {at-tay'naw}; or fattennah {at-tane'-naw}; a primitive pronoun of the second person; thou and thee, or (plural) ye and you:--thee, thou, ye, you.
00864\ 864 'Etham ay-thawm' of Egyptian derivation; Etham, a place in the Desert:--Etham.
00871\ 871 'Athariym ath-aw-reem' plural from an unused root (probably meaning to step); places; Atharim, a place near Palestine:--spies.
00874\ 874 ba'ar baw-ar' a primitive root; to dig; by analogy, to engrave; figuratively, to explain:--declare, (make) plain(-ly).

00887\ 887 ba'ash baw-ash' a primitive root; to smell bad; figuratively, to be offensive morally:--(make to) be abhorred (had in abomination, loathsome, odious), (cause a, make to) stink(-ing savour), X utterly.
00892\ 892 babah baw-baw' feminine active participle of an unused root meaning to hollow out; something hollowed (as a gate), i.e. pupil of the eye:--apple (of the eye).
00893\ 893 Bebay bay-bah'ee probably of foreign origin; Bebai, an Israelite:--Bebai.

00898\ 898 bagad baw-gad' a primitive root; to cover (with a garment); figuratively, to act covertly; by implication, to pillage:--deal deceitfully (treacherously, unfaithfully), offend, transgress(-or), (depart), treacherous (dealer, -ly, man), unfaithful(-ly, man), X very.
00902\ 902 Bigvay big-vah'ee probably of foreign origin; Bigvai, an Israelite:--Bigvai.
00903\ 903 Bigtha' big-thaw' of Persian derivation; Bigtha, a eunuch of Xerxes:--Bigtha.
00908\ 908 bada' baw-daw' a primitive root; (figuratively) to invent:--devise, feign.
00909\ 909 badad baw-dad' a primitive root; to divide, i.e. (reflex.) be solitary:--alone.

00914\ 914 badal baw-dal' a primitive root; to divide (in variation senses literally or figuratively, separate, distinguish, differ, select, etc.):-- (make, put) difference, divide (asunder), (make) separate (self, -ation), sever (out), X utterly.
00922\ 922 bohuw bo'-hoo from an unused root (meaning to be empty); a vacuity, i.e. (superficially) an undistinguishable ruin:--emptiness, void.
00923\ 923 behat bah'-hat from an unused root (probably meaning to glisten); white marble or perhaps alabaster:--red (marble).
00925\ 925 bahiyr baw-here' from an unused root (meaning to be bright); shining:--bright.

00926\ 926 bahal baw-hal' a primitive root; to tremble inwardly (or palpitate), i.e. (figuratively) be (causative, make) (suddenly) alarmed or agitated; by implication to hasten anxiously:--be (make) affrighted (afraid, amazed, dismayed, rash), (be, get, make) haste(-n, -y, -ily), (give) speedy(-ily), thrust out, trouble, vex.
00929\ 929 bhemah be-hay-maw' from an unused root (probably meaning to be mute); properly, a dumb beast; especially any large quadruped or animal (often collective):--beast, cattle.
00931\ 931 bohen bo'-hen from an unused root apparently meaning to be thick; the thumb of the hand or great toe of the foot:--thumb, great toe.
00933\ 933 bohaq bo'-hak from an unused root meaning to be pale; white scurf:--freckled spot.

00935\ 935 bow' bo a primitive root; to go or come (in a wide variety of applications):--abide, apply, attain, X be, befall, + besiege, bring (forth, in, into, to pass), call, carry, X certainly, (cause, let, thing for) to come (against, in, out, upon, to pass), depart, X doubtless again, + eat, + employ, (cause to) enter (in, into, -tering, -trance, -try), be fallen, fetch, + follow, get, give, go (down, in, to war), grant, + have, X indeed, (in-)vade, lead, lift (up), mention, pull in, put, resort, run (down), send, set, X (well) stricken (in age), X surely, take (in), way.
00936\ 936 buwz booz a primitive root; to disrespect:--contemn, despise, X utterly.
00942\ 942 Bavvay bav-vah'ee probably of Persian origin; Bavvai, an Israelite:--Bavai.
00943\ 943 buwk book a primitive root; to involve (literally or figuratively):--be entangled, (perplexed).
00947\ 947 buwc boos a primitive root; to trample (literally or figuratively):--loath, tread (down, under (foot)), be polluted.
00948\ 948 buwts boots from an unused root (of the same form) meaning to bleach, i.e. (intransitive) be white; probably cotton (of some sort):--fine (white) linen.
00950\ 950 buwqah boo-kaw' feminine passive participle of an unused root (meaning to be hollow); emptiness (as adjective):--empty.
00952\ 952 buwr boor a primitive root; to bore, i.e. (figuratively) examine:--declare.

00954\ 954 buwsh boosh a primitive root; properly, to pale, i.e. by implication to be ashamed; also (by implication) to be disappointed or delayed:--(be, make, bring to, cause, put to, with, a-)shamed(-d), be (put to) confounded(-fusion), become dry, delay, be long.
00958\ 958 baza' baw-zaw' a primitive root; probably to cleave:--spoil.
00959\ 959 bazah baw-zaw' a primitive root; to disesteem:--despise, disdain, contemn(-ptible), + think to scorn, vile person.
00962\ 962 bazaz baw-zaz' a primitive root; to plunder:--catch, gather, (take) for a prey, rob(-ber), spoil, take (away, spoil), X utterly.
00965\ 965 bazaq baw-zawk' from an unused root meaning to lighten; a flash of lightning:--flash of lightning.
00967\ 967 bazar baw-zar' a primitive root; to disperse:--scatter.
00968\ 968 Biztha' biz-thaw' of Persian origin; Biztha, a eunuch of Xerxes:--Biztha.
00974\ 974 bachan baw-khan' a primitive root; to test (especially metals); generally and figuratively, to investigate:--examine, prove, tempt, try (trial).
00977\ 977 bachar baw-khar' a primitive root; properly, to try, i.e. (by implication) select:--acceptable, appoint, choose (choice), excellent, join, be rather, require.
00981\ 981 bata' baw-taw' or batah {baw-taw'}; a primitive root; to babble; hence, to vociferate angrily:--pronounce, speak (unadvisedly).
00988\ 988 batel baw-tale' a primitive root; to desist from labor:--cease.
00990\ 990 beten beh'-ten from an unused root probably meaning to be hollow; the belly, especially the womb; also the bosom or body of anything:-- belly, body, + as they be born, + within, womb.

00995\ 995 biyn bene a primitive root; to separate mentally (or distinguish), i.e.(generally) understand:--attend, consider, be cunning, diligently, direct, discern, eloquent, feel, inform, instruct, have intelligence, know, look well to, mark, perceive, be prudent, regard, (can) skill(-full), teach, think, (cause, make to, get, give, have) understand(-ing), view, (deal) wise(-ly, man).
01002\ 1002 biyrah bee-raw' of foreign origin; a castle or palace:--palace.
01058\ 1058 bakah baw-kaw' a primitive root; to weep; generally to bemoan:--X at all, bewail, complain, make lamentation, X more, mourn, X sore, X with tears, weep.
01082\ 1082 balag baw-lag' a primitive root; to break off or loose (in a favorable or unfavorable sense), i.e. desist (from grief) or invade (with destruction):--comfort, (recover) strength(-en).
01085\ 1085 Bildad bil-dad' of uncertain derivation; Bildad, one of Job's friends:--Bildad.
01086\ 1086 balah baw-law' a primitive root; to fail; by implication to wear out, decay (causatively, consume, spend):--consume, enjoy long, become (make, wax) old, spend, waste.
01095\ 1095 Beltsha'tstsar bale-tesh-ats-tsar' of foreign derivation; Belteshatstsar, the Babylonian name of Daniel:--Belteshazzar.
01102\ 1102 balam baw-lam' a primitive root; to muzzle:--be held in.
01103\ 1103 balac baw-las' a primitive root; to pinch sycamore figs (a process necessary to ripen them):--gatherer.
01104\ 1104 bala` baw-lah' a primitive root; to make away with (specifically by swallowing); generally, to destroy:--cover, destroy, devour, eat up, be at end, spend up, swallow down (up).
01110\ 1110 balaq baw-lak' a primitive root; to annihilate:--(make) waste.
01114\ 1114 Bilshan bil-shawn' of uncertain derivation; Bilshan, an Israelite:--Bilshan.
01116\ 1116 bamah bam-maw' from an unused root (meaning to be high); an elevation:--height, high place, wave.
01119\ 1119 bmow bem-o' prolongation for prepositional prefix; in, with, by, etc.:--for, in into, through.
01129\ 1129 banah baw-naw' a primitive root; to build (literally and figuratively):--(begin to) build(-er), obtain children, make, repair, set (up), X surely.
01149\ 1149 bnac ben-as' (Aramaic) of uncertain affinity; to be enraged:--be angry.
01150\ 1150 Bin`a' bin-aw' or Bincah {bin-aw'}; of uncertain derivation; Bina or Binah, an Israelite:--Binea, Bineah.
01154\ 1154 becer beh'-ser from an unused root meaning to be sour; an immature grape:--unripe grape.
01162\ 1162 Bo`az bo'-az from an unused root of uncertain meaning; Boaz, the ancestor of David; also the name of a pillar in front of the temple:--Boaz.
01163\ 1163 ba`at baw-at' a primitive root; to trample down, i.e. (figuratively) despise:--kick.
01201\ 1201 Ba`sha' bah-shaw' from an unused root meaning to stink; offensiveness; Basha, a king of Israel:--Baasha.
01204\ 1204 ba`ath baw-ath' a primitive root; to fear:--affright, be (make) afraid, terrify, trouble.
01211\ 1211 btsel beh'-tsel from an unused root apparently meaning to peel; an onion:--onion.

01214\ 1214 batsa` baw-tsah' a primitive root to break off, i.e. (usually) plunder; figuratively, to finish, or (intransitively) stop:--(be) covet(- ous), cut (off), finish, fulfill, gain (greedily), get, be given to (covetousness), greedy, perform, be wounded.
01216\ 1216 batseq baw-tsake' a primitive root; perhaps to swell up, i.e. blister:--swell.

01234\ 1234 baqa` baw-kah' a primitive root; to cleave; generally, to rend, break, rip or open:--make a breach, break forth (into, out, in pieces, through, up), be ready to burst, cleave (asunder), cut out, divide, hatch, rend (asunder), rip up, tear, win.
01238\ 1238 baqaq baw-kah' a primitive root; to pour out, i.e. to empty, figuratively, to depopulate; by analogy, to spread out (as a fruitful vine):--(make) empty (out), fail, X utterly, make void.

01254\ 1254 bara' baw-raw' a primitive root; (absolutely) to create; (qualified) to cut down (a wood), select, feed (as formative processes):-- choose, create (creator), cut down, dispatch, do, make (fat).
01258\ 1258 barad baw-rad' a primitive root, to hail:--hail.
01264\ 1264 browm ber-ome' probably of foreign origin; damask (stuff of variegated thread):--rich apparel.
01265\ 1265 browsh ber-osh' of uncertain derivation; a cypress (?) tree; hence, a lance or a musical instrument (as made of that wood):--fir (tree).
01269\ 1269 Birzowth beer-zoth' probably feminine plural from an unused root (apparently mean to pierce); holes; Birzoth, an Israelite:--Birzavith (from the marg.).
01272\ 1272 barach baw-rakh' a primitive root; to bolt, i.e. figuratively, to flee suddenly:--chase (away); drive away, fain, flee (away), put to flight, make haste, reach, run away, shoot.
01276\ 1276 Beriy bay-ree' of uncertain derivation; (only in the plural and with the article) the Berites, a place in Palestine:--Berites.

01288\ 1288 barak baw-rak' a primitive root; to kneel; by implication to bless God (as an act of adoration), and (vice-versa) man (as a benefit); also (by euphemism) to curse (God or the king, as treason):--X abundantly, X altogether, X at all, blaspheme, bless, congratulate, curse, X greatly, X indeed, kneel (down), praise, salute, X still, thank.
01298\ 1298 Bera` beh'-rah of uncertain derivation; Bera, a Sodomitish king:--Bera.
01299\ 1299 baraq baw-rak' a primitive root; to lighten (lightning):--cast forth.
01302\ 1302 Barqowc bar-kose' of uncertain derivation; Barkos, one of the Nethimim:--Barkos.
01305\ 1305 barar baw-rar' a primitive root; to clarify (i.e. brighten), examine, select:--make bright, choice, chosen, cleanse (be clean), clearly, polished, (shew self) pure(-ify), purge (out).
01312\ 1312 Bishlam bish-lawm' of foreign derivation; Bishlam, a Pers.:--Bishlam.
01316\ 1316 Bashan baw-shawn' of uncertain derivation; Bashan (often with the article), a region East of the Jordan:--Bashan.
01318\ 1318 bashac baw-shas' a primitive root; to trample down:--tread.

01319\ 1319 basar baw-sar' a primitive root; properly, to be fresh, i.e. full (rosy, (figuratively) cheerful); to announce (glad news):--messenger, preach, publish, shew forth, (bear, bring, carry, preach, good, tell good) tidings.
01327\ 1327 battah bat-taw' feminine from an unused root (meaning to break in pieces); desolation:--desolate.

01330\ 1330 bthuwlah beth-oo-law' feminine passive participle of an unused root meaning to separate; a virgin (from her privacy); sometimes (by continuation) a bride; also (figuratively) a city or state:--maid, virgin.
01333\ 1333 bathaq baw-thak' a primitive root; to cut in pieces:--thrust through.
01334\ 1334 bathar baw-thar' a primitive root, to chop up:--divide.
01342\ 1342 ga'ah gaw-aw' a primitive root; to mount up; hence, in general, to rise, (figuratively) be majestic:--gloriously, grow up, increase, be risen, triumph.

01350\ 1350 ga'al gaw-al' a primitive root, to redeem (according to the Oriental law of kinship), i.e. to be the next of kin (and as such to buy back a relative's property, marry his widow, etc.):--X in any wise, X at all, avenger, deliver, (do, perform the part of near, next) kinsfolk(-man), purchase, ransom, redeem(-er), revenger.
01360\ 1360 gebe geh'-beh from an unused root meaning probably to collect; a reservoir; by analogy, a marsh:--marish, pit.
01361\ 1361 gabahh gaw-bah' a primitive root; to soar, i.e. be lofty; figuratively, to be haughty:--exalt, be haughty, be (make) high(-er), lift up, mount up, be proud, raise up great height, upward.
01371\ 1371 gibbeach ghib-bay'-akh from an unused root meaning to be high (in the forehead); bald in the forehead:--forehead bald.
01375\ 1375 gbiya` gheb-ee'-ah from an unused root (meaning to be convex); a goblet; by analogy, the calyx of a flower:--house, cup, pot.
01378\ 1378 gabiysh gaw-beesh' from an unused root (probably meaning to freeze); crystal (from its resemblance to ice):--pearl.
01384\ 1384 gibben gib-bane' from an unused root meaning to be arched or contracted; hunch-backed:--crookbackt.

01396\ 1396 gabar gaw-bar' a primitive root; to be strong; by implication, to prevail, act insolently:--exceed, confirm, be great, be mighty, prevail, put to more (strength), strengthen, be stronger, be valiant.
01415\ 1415 gadah gaw-daw' from an unused root (meaning to cut off); a border of a river (as cut into by the stream):--bank.
01430\ 1430 gadiysh gaw-deesh' from an unused root (meaning to heap up); a stack of sheaves; by analogy, a tomb:--shock (stack) (of corn), tomb.
01438\ 1438 gada` gaw-dah' a primitive root; to fell a tree; generally, to destroy anything:--cut (asunder, in sunder, down, off), hew down.
01442\ 1442 gadaph gaw-daf' a primitive root; to hack (with words), i.e. revile:--blaspheme, reproach.
01443\ 1443 gadar gaw-dar' a primitive root; to wall in or around:--close up, fence up, hedge, inclose, make up (a wall), mason, repairer.
01455\ 1455 gahah gaw-haw' a primitive root; to remove (a bandage from a wound, i.e. heal it):--cure.
01457\ 1457 gahar gaw-har' a primitive root; to prostrate oneself:--cast self down, stretch self.
01461\ 1461 guwb goob a primitive root; to dig:--husbandman.
01463\ 1463 Gowg gohg of uncertain derivation; Gog, the name of an Israelite, also of some nothern nation:--Gog.
01475\ 1475 guwmmats goom-mawts' of uncertain derivation; a pit:--pit.
01478\ 1478 gava` gaw-vah' a primitive root; to breathe out, i.e. (by implication) expire:--die, be dead, give up the ghost, perish.
01479\ 1479 guwph goof a primitive root; properly, to hollow or arch, i.e. (figuratively) close; to shut:--shut.

01481\ 1481 guwr goor a primitive root; properly, to turn aside from the road (for a lodging or any other purpose), i.e. sojourn (as a guest); also to shrink, fear (as in a strange place); also to gather for hostility (as afraid):--abide, assemble, be afraid, dwell, fear, gather (together), inhabitant, remain, sojourn, stand in awe, (be) stranger, X surely.

01486\ 1486 gowral go-rawl' or (shortened) goral {go-ral'}; from an unused root meaning to be rough (as stone); properly, a pebble, i.e. a lot (small stones being used for that purpose); figuratively, a portion or destiny (as if determined by lot):--lot.
01487\ 1487 guwsh goosh or rather (by permutation) giysh {gheesh}; of uncertain derivation; a mass of earth:--clod.
01489\ 1489 gizbar ghiz-bawr' of foreign derivation; treasurer:--treasurer.
01493\ 1493 Gizowniy ghee-zo-nee' patrial from the unused name of a place apparently in Palestine; a Gizonite or inhabitant of Gizoh:--Gizonite.
01497\ 1497 gazal gaw-zal' a primitive root; to pluck off; specifically to flay, strip or rob:--catch, consume, exercise (robbery), pluck (off), rob, spoil, take away (by force, violence), tear.
01501\ 1501 gazam gaw-zawm' from an unused root meaning to devour; a kind of locust:--palmer-worm.
01503\ 1503 geza' geh'-zah from an unused root meaning to cut down (trees); the trunk or stump of a tree (as felled or as planted):--stem, stock.
01504\ 1504 gazar gaw-zar' a primitive root; to cut down or off; (figuratively) to destroy, divide, exclude, or decide:--cut down (off), decree, divide, snatch.
01513\ 1513 gechel geh'-khel or (feminine) gacheleth {gah-kheh'-leth}; from an unused root meaning to glow or kindle; an ember:--(burning) coal.
01514\ 1514 Gacham gah'-kham from an unused root meaning to burn; flame; Gacham, a son of Nahor:--Gaham.
01515\ 1515 Gachar gah'-khar from an unused root meaning to hide; lurker; Gachar, one of the Nethinim:--Gahar.
01518\ 1518 giyach ghee'-akh or (shortened) goach {go'-akh}; a primitive root; to gush forth (as water), generally to issue:--break forth, labor to bring forth, come forth, draw up, take out.

01523\ 1523 giyl gheel or (by permutation) guwl {gool}; a primitive root; properly, to spin round (under the influence of any violent emotion), i.e. usually rejoice, or (as cringing) fear:--be glad, joy, be joyful, rejoice.
01527\ 1527 Giynath ghee-nath' of uncertain derivation; Ginath, an Israelite:--Ginath.
01532\ 1532 gallab gal-lawb' from an unused root meaning to shave; a barber:--barber.
01539\ 1539 geled ghe'-led from an unused root probably meaning to polish; the (human) skin (as smooth):--skin.

01540\ 1540 galah gaw-law' a primitive root; to denude (especially in a disgraceful sense); by implication, to exile (captives being usually stripped); figuratively, to reveal:--+ advertise, appear, bewray, bring, (carry, lead, go) captive (into captivity), depart, disclose, discover, exile, be gone, open, X plainly, publish, remove, reveal, X shamelessly, shew, X surely, tell, uncover.
01548\ 1548 galach gaw-lakh' a primitive root; properly, to be bald, i.e. (causatively) to shave; figuratively to lay waste:--poll, shave (off).
01563\ 1563 galam gaw-lam' a primitive root; to fold:--wrap together.
01566\ 1566 gala` gaw-lah' a primitive root; to be obstinate:--(inter-)meddle (with).
01570\ 1570 galash gaw-lash' a primitive root; probably to caper (as a goat):--appear.

01571\ 1571 gam gam by contraction from an unused root meaning to gather; properly, assemblage; used only adverbially also, even, yea, though; often repeated as correl. both...and:--again, alike, also, (so much) as (soon), both (so)...and , but, either...or, even, for all, (in) likewise (manner), moreover, nay...neither, one, then(-refore), though, what, with, yea.
01572\ 1572 gama' gaw-maw' a primitive root (literally or figuratively) to absorb:--swallow, drink.
01574\ 1574 gomed go'-med from an unused root apparently meaning to grasp; properly, a span:--cubit.
01579\ 1579 Gimzow ghim-zo' of uncertain derivation; Gimzo, a place in Palestine:--Gimzo.

01580\ 1580 gamal gaw-mal' a primitive root; to treat a person (well or ill), i.e. benefit or requite; by implication (of toil), to ripen, i.e. (specifically) to wean:--bestow on, deal bountifully, do (good), recompense, requite, reward, ripen, + serve, mean, yield.
01584\ 1584 gamar gaw-mar' a primitive root; to end (in the sense of completion or failure):--cease, come to an end, fail, perfect, perform.
01589\ 1589 ganab gaw-nab' a primitive root; to thieve (literally or figuratively); by implication, to deceive:--carry away, X indeed, secretly bring, steal (away), get by stealth.
01595\ 1595 genez gheh'-nez from an unused root meaning to store; treasure; by implication, a coffer:--chest, treasury.
01598\ 1598 ganan gaw-nan' a primitive root; to hedge about, i.e. (generally) protect:--defend.
01600\ 1600 ga`ah gaw-aw' a primitive root; to bellow (as cattle):--low.
01602\ 1602 ga`al gaw-al' a primitive root; to detest; by implication, to reject:--abhor, fail, lothe, vilely cast away.
01605\ 1605 ga`ar gaw-ar' a primitive root; to chide:--corrupt, rebuke, reprove.
01607\ 1607 ga`ash gaw-ash' a primitive root to agitate violently:--move, shake, toss, trouble.
01609\ 1609 Ga`tam gah-tawm' of uncertain derivation; Gatam, an Edomite:--Gatam.
01610\ 1610 gaph gaf from an unused root meaning to arch; the back; by extensive the body or self:--+ highest places, himself.
01612\ 1612 gephen gheh'-fen from an unused root meaning to bend; a vine (as twining), especially the grape:--vine, tree.
01613\ 1613 gopher go'-fer from an unused root, probably meaning to house in; a kind of tree or wood (as used for building), apparently the cypress:-- gopher.
01618\ 1618 garab gaw-rawb' from an unused root meaning to scratch; scurf (from itching):--scab, scurvy.
01622\ 1622 Girgashiy ghir-gaw-shee' patrial from an unused name (of uncertain derivation); a Girgashite, one of the native tribes of Canaan:--Girgashite, Girgasite.
01623\ 1623 garad gaw-rad' a primitive root; to abrade:--scrape.
01624\ 1624 garah gaw-raw' a primitive root; properly, to grate, i.e. (figuratively) to anger:--contend, meddle, stir up, strive.
01629\ 1629 garaz gaw-raz' a primitive root; to cut off:--cut off.
01637\ 1637 goren go'-ren from an unused root meaning to smooth; a threshing- floor (as made even); by analogy, any open area:--(barn, corn, threshing- )floor, (threshing-, void) place.
01638\ 1638 garac gaw-ras' a primitive root; to crush; also (intransitively and figuratively) to dissolve:--break.
01639\ 1639 gara` gaw-rah' a primitive root; to scrape off; by implication, to shave, remove, lessen, withhold:--abate, clip, (di-)minish, do (take) away, keep back, restrain, make small, withdraw.
01640\ 1640 garaph gaw-raf' a primitive root; to bear off violently:--sweep away.
01641\ 1641 garar gaw-rar' a primitive root; to drag off roughly; by implication, to bring up the cud (i.e. ruminate); by analogy, to saw:--catch, chew, X continuing, destroy, saw.
01643\ 1643 geres gheh'-res from an unused root meaning to husk; a kernel (collectively), i.e. grain:--beaten corn.

01644\ 1644 garash gaw-rash' a primitive root; to drive out from a possession; especially to expatriate or divorce:--cast up (out), divorced (woman), drive away (forth, out), expel, X surely put away, trouble, thrust out.
01650\ 1650 Gshuwr ghesh-oor' from an unused root (meaning to join); bridge; Geshur, a district of Syria:--Geshur, Geshurite.
01652\ 1652 gasham gaw-sham' a primitive root; to shower violently:--(cause to) rain.
01657\ 1657 Goshen go'-shen probably of Egyptian origin; Goshen, the residence of the Israelites in Egypt; also a place in Palestine:--Goshen.
01658\ 1658 Gishpa' ghish-paw' of uncertain derivation; Gishpa, an Israelite:--Gispa.
01659\ 1659 gashash gaw-shash' a primitive root; apparently to feel about:--grope.
01666\ 1666 Gether gheh'-ther of uncertain derivation; Gether, a son of Aram, and the region settled by him:--Gether.
01669\ 1669 da'ab daw-ab' a primitive root; to pine:--mourn, sorrow(-ful).
01672\ 1672 da'ag daw-ag' a primitive root; be anxious:--be afraid (careful, sorry), sorrow, take thought.
01675\ 1675 da'ah daw-aw' a primitive root; to dart, i.e. fly rapidly:--fly.

01686\ 1686 dibyown dib-yone' in the margin for the textual reading, cheryown {kher-yone'}; both (in the plural only and) of uncertain derivation; probably some cheap vegetable, perhaps a bulbous root:--dove's dung.

01692\ 1692 dabaq daw-bak' a primitive root; properly, to impinge, i.e. cling or adhere; figuratively, to catch by pursuit:--abide fast, cleave (fast together), follow close (hard after), be joined (together), keep (fast), overtake, pursue hard, stick, take.

01696\ 1696 dabar daw-bar' a primitive root; perhaps properly, to arrange; but used figuratively (of words), to speak; rarely (in a destructive sense) to subdue:--answer, appoint, bid, command, commune, declare, destroy, give, name, promise, pronounce, rehearse, say, speak, be spokesman, subdue, talk, teach, tell, think, use (entreaties), utter, X well, X work.
01706\ 1706 dbash deb-ash' from an unused root meaning to be gummy; honey (from its stickiness); by analogy, syrup:--honey((-comb)).
01713\ 1713 dagal daw-gal' a primitive root; to flaunt, i.e. raise a flag; figuratively, to be conspicuous:--(set up, with) banners, chiefest.
01716\ 1716 dagar daw-gar' a primitive root, to brood over eggs or young:--gather, sit.
01718\ 1718 dadah daw-daw' a doubtful root; to walk gently:--go (softly, with).
01719\ 1719 Ddan ded-awn' or (prolonged) Ddaneh (Ezek. 25:13) {deh-daw'- neh}; of uncertain derivation; Dedan, the name of two Cushites and of their territory:--Dedan.
01721\ 1721 Dodaniym do-daw-neem' or (by orthographical error) Rodaniym (1 Chron. 1:7) {ro-daw-neem'}; a plural of uncertain derivation; Dodanites, or descendants of a son of Javan:--Dodanim.
01723\ 1723 Dahava` dah-hav-aw' (Aramaic) of uncertain derivation; Dahava, a people colonized in Samaria:--Dehavites.
01725\ 1725 dahar daw-har' a primitive root; to curvet or move irregularly:--pause.
01727\ 1727 duwb doob a primitive root; to mope, i.e. (figuratively) pine:-- sorrow.

01730\ 1730 dowd dode or (shortened) dod {dode}; from an unused root meaning properly, to boil, i.e. (figuratively) to love; by implication, a love- token, lover, friend; specifically an uncle:--(well-)beloved, father's brother, love, uncle.
01738\ 1738 davah daw-vaw' a primitive root; to be sick (as if in menstruation):--infirmity.
01740\ 1740 duwach doo'-akh a primitive root; to thrust away; figuratively, to cleanse:--cast out, purge, wash.
01743\ 1743 duwk dook a primitive root; to bruise in a mortar:--beat.
01744\ 1744 duwkiyphath doo-kee-fath' of uncertain derivation; the hoopoe or else the grouse:--lapwing.
01749\ 1749 downag do-nag' of uncertain derivation; wax; -wax.
01750\ 1750 duwts doots a primitive root; to leap:--be turned.
01752\ 1752 duwr dure a primitive root; properly, to gyrate (or move in a circle), i.e. to remain:--dwell.
01760\ 1760 dachah daw-khaw' or dachach {Jer. 23:12) {daw-khakh'}; a primitive root; to push down:--chase, drive away (on), overthrow, outcast, X sore, thrust, totter.
01764\ 1764 dochan do'-khan of uncertain derivation; millet:--millet.
01765\ 1765 dachaph daw-khaf' a primitive root; to urge, i.e. hasten:--(be) haste(-ned), pressed on.
01766\ 1766 dachaq daw-khak' a primitive root; to press, i.e. oppress:--thrust, vex.

01767\ 1767 day dahee of uncertain derivation; enough (as noun or adverb), used chiefly with preposition in phrases:--able, according to, after (ability), among, as (oft as), (more than) enough, from, in, since, (much as is) sufficient(-ly), too much, very, when.
01773\ 1773 dyow deh-yo' of uncertain derivation; ink:--ink.
01777\ 1777 diyn deen or (Gen. 6:3) duwn {doon}; a primitive roy a straight course, i.e. sail direct:--(come) with a straight course.
01784\ 1784 Diynay dee-nah'-ee (Aramaic) partial from uncertain primitive; a Dinaite or inhabitant of some unknown Assyria province:--Dinaite.
01801\ 1801 dalag daw-lag' a primitive root; to spring:--leap.
01804\ 1804 dalach daw-lakh' a primitive root; to roil water:--trouble.
01810\ 1810 Dil`an dil-awn' of uncertain derivation; Dilan, a place in Palestine:--Dilean.
01811\ 1811 dalaph daw-laf' a primitive root; to drip; by implication, to weep:--drop through, melt, pour out.
01814\ 1814 dalaq daw-lak' a primitive root; to flame (literally or figuratively):--burning, chase, inflame, kindle, persecute(-or), pursue hotly.
01819\ 1819 damah daw-maw' a primitive root; to compare; by implication, to resemble, liken, consider:--compare, devise, (be) like(-n), mean, think, use similitudes.
01820\ 1820 damah daw-mam' a primitive root; to be dumb or silent; hence, to fail or perish; trans. to destroy:--cease, be cut down (off), destroy, be brought to silence, be undone, X utterly.
01828\ 1828 domen do'-men of uncertain derivation; manure:--dung.
01830\ 1830 dama` daw-mah' a primitive root; to weep:--X sore, weep.
01834\ 1834 Dammeseq dam-meh'-sek or Duwmeseq {doo-meh'-sek}; or Darmeseq {dar-meh'-sek}; of foreign origin; Damascus, a city of Syria:--Damascus.
01837\ 1837 Dannah dan-naw' of uncertain derivation; Dannah, a place in Palestine:--Dannah.
01838\ 1838 Dinhabah din-haw-baw' of uncertain derivation; Dinhabah, an Edomitish town:--Dinhaban.
01846\ 1846 da`ak daw-ak' a primitive root; to be extinguished; figuratively, to expire or be dried up:--be extinct, consumed, put out, quenched.
01848\ 1848 dophiy dof'-ee from an unused root (meaning to push over); a stumbling-block:--slanderest.
01849\ 1849 daphaq daw-fak' a primitive root; to knock; by analogy, to press severely:--beat, knock, overdrive.
01853\ 1853 Diqlah dik-law' of foreign origin; Diklah, a region of Arabia:--Diklah.
01856\ 1856 daqar daw-kar' a primitive root; to stab; by analogy, to starve; figuratively, to revile:--pierce, strike (thrust) through, wound.
01860\ 1860 dra'own der-aw-one' or dera)own {day-raw-one;}; from an unused root (meaning to repulse); an object of aversion:--abhorring, contempt.
01861\ 1861 dorbown dor-bone' (also dor-bawn'); of uncertain derivation; a goad:--goad.
01863\ 1863 dardar dar-dar' of uncertain derivation; a thorn:--thistle.
01864\ 1864 darowm daw-rome' of uncertain derivation; the south; poet. the south wind:--south.
01865\ 1865 drowr der-ore' from an unused root (meaning to move rapidly); freedom; hence, spontaneity of outflow, and so clear:--liberty, pure.
01867\ 1867 Dar`yavesh daw-reh-yaw-vaysh' of Persian origin; Darejavesh, a title (rather than name) of several Persian kings:--Darius.

01869\ 1869 darak daw-rak' a primitive root; to tread; by implication, to walk; also to string a bow (by treading on it in bending):--archer, bend, come, draw, go (over), guide, lead (forth), thresh, tread (down), walk.
01871\ 1871 darkmown dar-kem-one' of Pers. origin; a "drachma," or coin:--dram.
01874\ 1874 Darqown dar-kone' of uncertain derivation; Darkon, one of "Solomon's servants":--Darkon.
01876\ 1876 dasha daw-shaw' a primitive root; to sprout:--bring forth, spring.
01881\ 1881 dath dawth of uncertain (perhaps foreign) derivation: a royal edict or statute:--commandment, commission, decree, law, manner.
01884\ 1884 dthabar deth-aw-bawr' (Aramaic) of Pers. origin; meaning one skilled in law; a judge:--counsellor.
01885\ 1885 Dathan daw-thawn' of uncertain derivation; Dathan, an Israelite:--Dathan.
01886\ 1886 Dothan do'-thawn or (Aramaic dual) Dothayin (Gen. 37:17) {do- thah'-yin}; of uncertain derivation; Dothan, a place in Palestine:--Dothan.
01887\ 1887 he' hay a primitive particle; lo!:--behold, lo.
01891\ 1891 habal haw-bal' a primitive root; to be vain in act, word, or expectation; specifically to lead astray:--be (become, make) vain.
01894\ 1894 hoben ho'-ben only in plural, from an unused root meaning to be hard; ebony:--ebony.
01895\ 1895 habar haw-bar' a primitive root of uncertain (perhaps foreign) derivation; to be a horoscopist:--+ (astro-)loger.
01896\ 1896 Hege' hay-gay' or (by permutation) Hegay {hay-gah'-ee}; probably of Persian origin; Hege or Hegai, a eunuch of Xerxes:--Hegai, Hege.
01898\ 1898 hagah haw-gaw' a primitive root; to remove:--stay, stay away.
01903\ 1903 hagiyn haw-gheen' of uncertain derivation; perhaps suitable or turning:--directly.
01904\ 1904 Hagar haw-gawr' of uncertain (perhaps foreign) derivation; Hagar, the mother of Ishmael:--Hagar.
01907\ 1907 haddabar had-daw-bawr' (Aramaic) probably of foreign origin; a vizier:--counsellor.
01912\ 1912 Hoduw ho'-doo of foreign origin; Hodu (i.e. Hindu-stan):--India.
01913\ 1913 Hadowram had-o-rawm' or Hadoram {had-o-rawm'}; probably of foreign derivation; Hadoram, a son of Joktan, and the tribe descended from him:-- Hadoram.
01914\ 1914 Hidday hid-dah'ee of uncertain derivation; Hiddai, an Israelite:--Hiddai.
01916\ 1916 hadom had-ome' from an unused root meaning to stamp upon; a foot stool:--(foot-)stool.
01918\ 1918 hadac had-as' of uncertain derivation; the myrtle:--myrtle (tree).
01920\ 1920 Hadaph haw-daf' a prim root; to push away or down:--cast away (out), drive, expel, thrust (away).

01921\ 1921 hadar haw-dar' a primitive root; to swell up (literally or figuratively, active or passive); by implication, to favor or honour, be high or proud:--countenance, crooked place, glorious, honour, put forth.

01931\ 1931 huw' hoo of which the feminine (beyond the Pentateuch) is hiyw {he}; a primitive word, the third person pronoun singular, he (she or it); only expressed when emphatic or without a verb; also (intensively) self, or (especially with the article) the same; sometimes (as demonstrative) this or that; occasionally (instead of copula) as or are:--he, as for her, him(-self), it, the same, she (herself), such, that (...it), these, they, this, those, which (is), who.
01935\ 1935 howd hode from an unused root; grandeur (i.e. an imposing form and appearance):--beauty, comeliness, excellency, glorious, glory, goodly, honour, majesty.
01944\ 1944 Howham ho-hawm' of uncertain derivation; Hoham, a Canaanitish king:--Hoham.
01951\ 1951 huwn hoon a primitive root; properly, to be naught, i.e. (figuratively) to be (causatively, act) light:--be ready.
01959\ 1959 heydad hay-dawd' from an unused root (meaning to shout); acclamation:--shout(-ing).
01969\ 1969 hiyn heen probably of Egyptian origin; a hin or liquid measure:--hin.
01970\ 1970 hakar haw-kar' a primitive root; apparently to injure:--make self strange.
01973\ 1973 halah haw-leh-aw' from the primitive form of the article (hal); to the distance, i.e. far away; also (of time) thus far:--back, beyond, (hence,-)forward, hitherto, thence,forth, yonder.

01984\ 1984 halal haw-lal' a primitive root; to be clear (orig. of sound, but usually of color); to shine; hence, to make a show, to boast; and thus to be (clamorously) foolish; to rave; causatively, to celebrate; also to stultify:--(make) boast (self), celebrate, commend, (deal, make), fool(- ish, -ly), glory, give (light), be (make, feign self) mad (against), give in marriage, (sing, be worthy of) praise, rage, renowned, shine.
01986\ 1986 halam haw-lam' a primitive root; to strike down; by implication, to hammer, stamp, conquer, disband:--beat (down), break (down), overcome, smite (with the hammer).
01990\ 1990 Ham hawm of uncertain derivation; Ham, a region of Palestine:--Ham.
02001\ 2001 Haman haw-mawn' of foreign derivation; Haman, a Persian vizier:--Haman.
02002\ 2002 hamniyk ham-neek' (Aramaic) but the text is hamuwnek {ham-oo-nayk'}; of foreign origin; a necklace:--chain.
02003\ 2003 hamac haw-mawce' from an unused root apparently meaning to crackle; a dry twig or brushwood:--melting.
02005\ 2005 hen hane a primitive particle; lo!; also (as expressing surprise) if:--behold, if, lo, though.
02011\ 2011 Hinnom hin-nome' probably of foreign origin; Hinnom, apparently a Jebusite:--Hinnom.
02012\ 2012 Hena` hay-nah' probably of foreign derivation; Hena, a place apparently in Mesopotamia:--Hena.
02013\ 2013 hacah haw-saw' a primitive root; to hush:--hold peace (tongue), (keep) silence, be silent, still.

02015\ 2015 haphak haw-fak' a primitive root; to turn about or over; by implication, to change, overturn, return, pervert:--X become, change, come, be converted, give, make (a bed), overthrow (-turn), perverse, retire, tumble, turn (again, aside, back, to the contrary, every way).
02021\ 2021 hotsen ho'-tsen from an unused root meaning apparently to be sharp or strong; a weapon of war:--chariot.
02026\ 2026 harag haw-rag' a primitive root; to smite with deadly intent:--destroy, out of hand, kill, murder(-er), put to (death), make (slaughter), slay(-er), X surely.
02029\ 2029 harah haw-raw' a primitive root; to be (or become) pregnant, conceive (literally or figuratively):--been, be with child, conceive, progenitor.
02036\ 2036 Horam ho-rawm' from an unused root (meaning to tower up); high; Horam, a Canaanitish king:--Horam.
02040\ 2040 harac haw-ras' a primitive root; to pull down or in pieces, break, & destroy:--beat down, break (down, through), destroy, overthrow, pluck down, pull down, ruin, throw down, X utterly.
02042\ 2042 harar haw-rawr' from an unused root meaning to loom up; a mountain:--hill, mount(-ain).
02047\ 2047 Hathak hath-awk' probably of foreign origin; Hathak, a Persian eunuch:--Hatach.
02048\ 2048 hathal haw-thal' a primitive root; to deride; by implication, to cheat:--deal deceitfully, deceive, mock.
02050\ 2050 hathath' haw-thath' a primitive root; properly, to break in upon, i.e. to assail:--imagine mischief.
02052\ 2052 Vaheb vaw-habe' of uncertain derivation; Vaheb, a place in Moab:--what he did.
02053\ 2053 vav vaw probably a hook (the name of the sixth Heb. letter):--hook.
02054\ 2054 vazar vaw-zawr' presumed to be from an unused root meaning to bear guilt; crime:--X strange.
02055\ 2055 Vayzatha' vah-yez-aw'-thaw of foreign origin; Vajezatha, a son of Haman:--Vajezatha.
02060\ 2060 Vashtiy vash-tee' of Persian origin; Vashti, the queen of Xerxes:--Vashti.
02061\ 2061 z'eb zeh-abe' from an unused root meaning to be yellow; a wolf:--wolf.
02064\ 2064 zabad zaw-bad' a primitive root; to confer:--endure.
02070\ 2070 zbuwb zeb-oob' from an unused root (meaning to flit); a fly (especially one of a stinging nature):--fly.
02076\ 2076 zabach zaw-bakh' a primitive root; to slaughter an animal (usually in sacrifice):--kill, offer, (do) sacrifice, slay.
02081\ 2081 Zbiyna' zeb-ee-naw' from an unused root (meaning to purchase); gainfulness; Zebina, an Israelite:--Zebina.
02082\ 2082 zabal zaw-bal' a primitive root; apparently properly, to inclose, i.e. to reside:--dwell with.
02085\ 2085 zag zawg from an unused root probably meaning to inclose; the skin of a grape:--husk.
02091\ 2091 zahab zaw-hawb' from an unused root meaning to shimmer; gold, figuratively, something gold-colored (i.e. yellow), as oil, a clear sky:-- gold(-en), fair weather.
02092\ 2092 zaham zaw-ham' a primitive root; to be rancid, i.e. (transitively) to loathe:--abhor.
02094\ 2094 zahar zaw-har' a primitive root; to gleam; figuratively, to enlighten (by caution):--admonish, shine, teach, (give) warn(-ing).

02100\ 2100 zuwb zoob a primitive root; to flow freely (as water), i.e. (specifically) to have a (sexual) flux; figuratively, to waste away; also to overflow:--flow, gush out, have a (running) issue, pine away, run.
seethe; figuratively, to be insolent:--be proud, deal proudly, & presume, (come) presumptuously, sod.
02105\ 2105 Zowcheth zo-khayth' of uncertain origin; Zocheth, an Israelite:--Zoheth.
02109\ 2109 zuwn zoon a primitive root; perhaps properly, to be plump, i.e. (transitively) to nourish:--feed.
02111\ 2111 zuwa` zoo'-ah a primitive root; properly, to shake off, i.e. (figuratively) to agitate (as with fear):--move, tremble, vex.

02114\ 2114 zuwr zoor a primitive root; to turn aside (especially for lodging); hence to be a foreigner, strange, profane; specifically (active participle) to commit adultery:--(come from) another (man, place), fanner, go away, (e-)strange(-r, thing, woman).
02118\ 2118 zachach zaw-khakh' a primitive root; to shove or displace:--loose.
02119\ 2119 zachal zaw-khal' a primitive root; to crawl; by implication, to fear:--be afraid, serpent, worm.
02123\ 2123 ziyz zeez from an unused root apparently meaning to be conspicuous; fulness of the breast; also a moving creature:--abundance, wild beast.
02153\ 2153 Zilpah zil-paw : from an unused root apparently meaning to trickle, as myrrh; fragrant dropping; Zilpah, Leah's maid:--Zilpah.
02161\ 2161 zamam zaw-mam' a primitive root; to plan, usually in a bad sense:--consider, devise, imagine, plot, purpose, think (evil).
02163\ 2163 zaman zaw-man' a primitive root; to fix (a time):--appoint.

02181\ 2181 zanah zaw-naw' a primitive root (highly-fed and therefore wanton); to commit adultery (usually of the female, and less often of simple fornication, rarely of involuntary ravishment); figuratively, to commit idolatry (the Jewish people being regarded as the spouse of Jehovah):--(cause to) commit fornication, X continually, X great, (be an, play the) harlot, (cause to be, play the) whore, (commit, fall to) whoredom, (cause to) go a-whoring, whorish.
02186\ 2186 zanach zaw-nakh' a primitive root meaning to push aside, i.e. reject, forsake, fail:--cast away (off), remove far away (off).
02187\ 2187 zanaq zaw-nak' a primitive root; properly, to draw together the feet (as an animal about to dart upon its prey), i.e. to spring forward:-- leap.
02193\ 2193 za`ak zaw-ak' a primitive root; to extinguish:--be extinct.
02194\ 2194 za`am zaw-am' a primitive root; properly, to foam at the mouth, i.e. to be enraged:--abhor, abominable, (be) angry, defy, (have) indignation.
02196\ 2196 za`aph zaw-af' a primitive root; properly, to boil up, i.e. (figuratively) to be peevish or angry:--fret, sad, worse liking, be wroth.

02199\ 2199 za`aq zaw-ak' a primitive root; to shriek (from anguish or danger); by analogy, (as a herald) to announce or convene publicly:-- assemble, call (together), (make a) cry (out), come with such a company, gather (together), cause to be proclaimed.
02202\ 2202 Ziphron zi-frone' from an unused root (meaning to be fragrant); Ziphron, a place in Palestine:--Ziphron.
02203\ 2203 zepheth zeh'-feth from an unused root (meaning to liquify); asphalt (from its tendency to soften in the sun):--pitch.
02204\ 2204 zaqen zaw-kane' a primitive root; to be old:--aged man, be (wax) old (man).
02210\ 2210 zaqaph zaw-kaf' a primitive root; to life, i.e. (figuratively) comfort:--raise (up).
02212\ 2212 zaqaq zaw-kak' a primitive root; to strain, (figuratively) extract, clarify:--fine, pour down, purge, purify, refine.
02215\ 2215 zarab zaw-rab' a primitive root; to flow away:--wax warm.
02218\ 2218 Zered zeh'-red from an unused root meaning to be exuberant in growth; lined with shrubbery; Zered, a brook East of the Dead Sea:--Zared, Zered.
02222\ 2222 zarziyph zar-zeef' by reduplication from an unused root meaning to flow; a pouring rain:--water.

02224\ 2224 zarach zaw-rakh' a primitive root; properly, to irradiate (or shoot forth beams), i.e. to rise (as the sun); specifically, to appear (as a symptom of leprosy):--arise, rise (up), as soon as it is up.
02229\ 2229 zaram zaw-ram' a primitive root; to gush (as water):--carry away as with a flood, pour out.
02236\ 2236 zaraq zaw-rak' a primitive root; to sprinkle (fluid or solid particles):--be here and there, scatter, sprinkle, strew.
02238\ 2238 Zeresh zeh'-resh of Persian origin; Zeresh, Haman's wife:--Zeresh.
02240\ 2240 Zattuw' zat-too' of uncertain derivation; Zattu, an Israelite:--Zattu.
02242\ 2242 Zethar zay-thar' of Persian origin; Zethar, a eunuch of Xerxes:--Zethar.
02251\ 2251 chabat khaw-bat' a primitive root; to knock out or off:--beat (off, out), thresh.

02254\ 2254 chabal khaw-bal' a primitive root; to wind tightly (as a rope), i.e. to bind; specifically, by a pledge; figuratively, to pervert, destroy; also to writhe in pain (especially of parturition):--X at all, band, bring forth, (deal) corrupt(-ly), destroy, offend, lay & to (take a) pledge, spoil, travail, X very, withhold.
02261\ 2261 chabatstseleth khab-ats-tseh'-leth of uncertain derivation; probably meadow-saffron:--rose.
02262\ 2262 Chabatstsanyah khab-ats-tsan-yaw' of uncertain derivation; Chabatstsanjah, a Rechabite:--Habazaniah.
02263\ 2263 chabaq khaw-bak' a primitive root; to clasp (the hands or in embrace):--embrace, fold.

02266\ 2266 chabar khaw-bar' a primitive root; to join (literally or figuratively); specifically (by means of spells) to fascinate:--charm(- er), be compact, couple (together), have fellowship with, heap up, join (self, together), league.

02280\ 2280 chabash khaw-bash' a primitive root; to wrap firmly (especially a turban, compress, or saddle); figuratively, to stop, to rule:--bind (up), gird about, govern, healer, put, saddle, wrap about.
02284\ 2284 chagab khaw-gawb' of uncertain derivation; a locust:--locust.
02288\ 2288 chagav khag-awv' from an unused root meaning to take refuge; a rift in rocks:--cleft.
02296\ 2296 chagar khaw-gar' a primitive root; to gird on (as a belt, armor, etc.):--be able to put on, be afraid, appointed, gird, restrain, X on every side.
02300\ 2300 chadad khaw-dad' a primitive root; to be (causatively, make) sharp or (figuratively) severe:--be fierce, sharpen.
02302\ 2302 chadah khaw-daw' a primitive root; to rejoice:--make glad, be joined, rejoice.

02308\ 2308 chadal khaw-dal' a primitive root; properly, to be flabby, i.e. (by implication) desist; (figuratively) be lacking or idle:--cease, end, fall, forbear, forsake, leave (off), let alone, rest, be unoccupied, want.
02312\ 2312 chedeq khay'-dek from an unused root meaning to sting; a prickly plant:--brier, thorn.
02313\ 2313 Chiddeqel khid-deh'-kel probably of foreign origin; the Chiddekel (or Tigris) river:--Hiddekel.
02314\ 2314 chadar khaw-dar' a primitive root; properly, to inclose (as a room), i.e. (by analogy,) to beset (as in a siege):--enter a privy chamber.
02317\ 2317 Chadrak khad-rawk' of uncertain derivation; Chadrak, a Syrian deity:--Hadrach.
02318\ 2318 chadash khaw-dash' a primitive root; to be new; causatively, to rebuild:--renew, repair.
02325\ 2325 chuwb khoob also chayab {khaw-yab'}; a primitive root; properly, perhaps to tie, i.e. (figuratively and reflexively) to owe, or (by implication) to forfeit:--make endanger.
02330\ 2330 chuwd khood a primitive root; properly, to tie a knot, i.e. (figuratively) to propound a riddle:--put forth.
02336\ 2336 chowach kho'-akh from an unused root apparently meaning to pierce; a thorn; by analogy, a ring for the nose:--bramble, thistle, thorn.
02339\ 2339 chuwt khoot from an unused root probably meaning to sew; a string; by implication, a measuring tape:--cord, fillet, line, thread.

02342\ 2342 chuwl khool or chiyl {kheel}; a primitive root; properly, to twist or whirl (in a circular or spiral manner), i.e. (specifically) to dance, to writhe in pain (especially of parturition) or fear; figuratively, to wait, to pervert:--bear, (make to) bring forth, (make to) calve, dance, drive away, fall grievously (with pain), fear, form, great, grieve, (be) grievous, hope, look, make, be in pain, be much (sore) pained, rest, shake, shapen, (be) sorrow(-ful), stay, tarry, travail (with pain), tremble, trust, wait carefully (patiently), be wounded.
02345\ 2345 chuwm khoom from an unused root meaning to be warm, i.e. (by implication) sunburnt or swarthy (blackish):--brown.
02346\ 2346 chowmah kho-maw' feminine active participle of an unused root apparently meaning to join; a wall of protection:--wall, walled.
02347\ 2347 chuwc khoos a primitive root; properly, to cover, i.e. (figuratively) to compassionate:--pity, regard, spare.
02348\ 2348 chowph khofe from an unused root meaning to cover; a cove (as a sheltered bay):--coast (of the sea), haven, shore, (sea-)side.

02351\ 2351 chuwts khoots or (shortened) chuts {khoots}; (both forms feminine in the plural) from an unused root meaning to sever; properly, separate by a wall, i.e. outside, outdoors:--abroad, field, forth, highway, more, out(-side, -ward), street, without.
02352\ 2352 chuwr khoor or (shortened) chur {khoor}; from an unused root probably meaning to bore; the crevice of a serpent; the cell of a prison:--hole.
02357\ 2357 chavar khaw-var' a primitive root; to blanch (as with shame):--wax pale.
02363\ 2363 chuwsh koosh a primitive root; to hurry; figuratively, to be eager with excitement or enjoyment:--(make) haste(-n), ready.
02385\ 2385 chaziyz khaw-zeez' from an unused root meaning to glare; a flash of lightning:--bright cloud, lightning.
02386\ 2386 chaziyr khaz-eer' from an unused root probably meaning to enclose; a hog (perhaps as penned):--boar, swine.

02388\ 2388 chazaq khaw-zak' a primitive root; to fasten upon; hence, to seize, be strong (figuratively, courageous, causatively strengthen, cure, help, repair, fortify), obstinate; to bind, restrain, conquer:--aid, amend, X calker, catch, cleave, confirm, be constant, constrain, continue, be of good (take) courage(-ous, -ly), encourage (self), be established, fasten, force, fortify, make hard, harden, help, (lay) hold (fast), lean, maintain, play the man, mend, become (wax) mighty, prevail, be recovered, repair, retain, seize, be (wax) sore, strengthen (self), be stout, be (make, shew, wax) strong(-er), be sure, take (hold), be urgent, behave self valiantly, withstand.

02398\ 2398 chata' khaw-taw' a primitive root; properly, to miss; hence (figuratively and generally) to sin; by inference, to forfeit, lack, expiate, repent, (causatively) lead astray, condemn:--bear the blame, cleanse, commit (sin), by fault, harm he hath done, loss, miss, (make) offend(-er), offer for sin, purge, purify (self), make reconciliation, (cause, make) sin(-ful, -ness), trespass.
02404\ 2404 chatab khaw-tab' a primitive root; to chop or carve wood:--cut down, hew(-er), polish.
02406\ 2406 chittah khit-taw' of uncertain derivation; wheat, whether the grain or the plant:--wheat(-en).
02407\ 2407 Chattuwsh khat-toosh' from an unused root of uncertain signification; Chattush, the name of four or five Israelites:--Hattush.
02410\ 2410 Chatiyta' khat-ee-taw' from an unused root apparently meaning to dig out; explorer; Chatita, a temple porter:--Hatita.
02411\ 2411 Chattiyl khat-teel' from an unused root apparently meaning to wave; fluctuating; Chattil, one of "Solomon's servants":--Hattil.
02413\ 2413 chatam khaw-tam' a primitive root; to stop:--refrain.
02414\ 2414 chataph khaw-taf' a primitive root; to clutch; hence, to seize as a prisoner:--catch.
02415\ 2415 choter kho'-ter from an unused root of uncertain signification; a twig:--rod.
02436\ 2436 cheyq khake or cheq {khake}; and chowq {khoke}; from an unused root, apparently meaning to inclose; the bosom (literally or figuratively):--bosom, bottom, lap, midst, within.
02447\ 2447 chakliyl khak-leel' by reduplication from an unused root apparently meaning to be dark; darkly flashing (only of the eyes); in a good sense, brilliant (as stimulated by wine):--red.
02449\ 2449 chakam khaw-kam' a primitive root, to be wise (in mind, word or act):--X exceeding, teach wisdom, be (make self, shew self) wise, deal (never so) wisely, make wiser.

02459\ 2459 cheleb kheh'-leb or cheleb {khay'-leb}; from an unused root meaning to be fat; fat, whether literally or figuratively; hence, the richest or choice part:--X best, fat(-ness), X finest, grease, marrow.
02465\ 2465 cheled kheh'-led from an unused root apparently meaning to glide swiftly; life (as a fleeting portion of time); hence, the world (as transient):--age, short time, world.
02477\ 2477 Chalach khal-akh' probably of foreign origin; Chalach, a region of Assyria:--Halah.
02480\ 2480 chalat khaw-lat' a primitive root; to snatch at:--catch.
02489\ 2489 chelka' khay-lek-aw' or chelkah {khay-lek-aw'}; apparently from an unused root probably meaning to be dark or (figuratively) unhappy; a wretch, i.e. unfortunate:--poor.

02492\ 2492 chalam khaw-lam' a primitive root; properly, to bind firmly, i.e. (by implication) to be (causatively to make) plump; also (through the figurative sense of dumbness) to dream:--(cause to) dream(-er), be in good liking, recover.

02498\ 2498 chalaph khaw-laf' a primitive root; properly, to slide by, i.e. (by implication) to hasten away, pass on, spring up, pierce or change:--abolish, alter, change, cut off, go on forward, grow up, be over, pass (away, on, through), renew, sprout, strike through.

02502\ 2502 chalats khaw-lats' a primitive root; to pull off; hence (intensively) to strip, (reflex.) to depart; by implication, to deliver, equip (for fight); present, strengthen:--arm (self), (go, ready) armed (X man, soldier), deliver, draw out, make fat, loose, (ready) prepared, put off, take away, withdraw self.

02505\ 2505 chalaq khaw-lak' a primitive root; to be smooth (figuratively); by implication (as smooth stones were used for lots) to apportion or separate:--deal, distribute, divide, flatter, give, (have, im-)part(-ner), take away a portion, receive, separate self, (be) smooth(-er).
02522\ 2522 chalash khaw-lash' a primitive root; to prostrate; by implication, to overthrow, decay:--discomfit, waste away, weaken.
02530\ 2530 chamad khaw-mad' a primitive root; to delight in:--beauty, greatly beloved, covet, delectable thing, (X great) delight, desire, goodly, lust, (be) pleasant (thing), precious (thing).
02546\ 2546 chomet kho'met from an unused root probably meaning, to lie low; a lizard (as creeping):--snail.
02550\ 2550 chamal khaw-mal' a primitive root; to commiserate; by implication, to spare:--have compassion, (have) pity, spare.
02552\ 2552 chamam khaw-mam' a primitive root; to be hot (literally or figuratively):--enflame self, get (have) heat, be (wax) hot, (be, wax) warm (self, at).
02554\ 2554 chamac khaw-mas' a primitive root; to be violent; by implication, to maltreat:--make bare, shake off, violate, do violence, take away violently, wrong, imagine wrongfully.
02556\ 2556 chamets khaw-mates' a primitive root; to be pungent; i.e. in taste (sour, i.e. literally fermented, or figuratively, harsh), in color (dazzling):--cruel (man), dyed, be grieved, leavened.
02559\ 2559 chamaq khaw-mak' a primitive root; properly, to wrap; hence, to depart (i.e. turn about):--go about, withdraw self.
02568\ 2568 chamesh khaw-maysh' masculine chamishshah {kham-ish-shaw}; a primitive numeral; five:--fif(-teen), fifth, five (X apiece).
02570\ 2570 chomesh kho'-mesh from an unused root probably meaning, to be stout; the abdomen (as obese):--fifth (rib).
02590\ 2590 chanat khaw-nat' a primitive root; to spice; by implication, to embalm; also to ripen:--embalm, put forth.
02602\ 2602 chanamal khan-aw-mawl' of uncertain derivation; perhaps the aphis or plantlouse:--frost.
02609\ 2609 Chanec khaw-nace' of Egyptian derivation; Chanes, a place in Egypt:--Hanes.
02610\ 2610 chaneph khaw-nafe' a primitive root; to soil, especially in a moral sense:--corrupt, defile, X greatly, pollute, profane.
02628\ 2628 chacal khaw-sal' a primitive root; to eat off:--consume.
02629\ 2629 chacam khaw-sam' a primitive root; to muzzle; by analogy, to stop the nose:--muzzle, stop.
02630\ 2630 chacan khaw-san' a primitive root; properly, to (be) compact; by implication, to hoard:--lay up.
02636\ 2636 chacpac khas-pas' reduplicated from an unused root meaning apparently to peel; a shred or scale:--round thing.
02637\ 2637 chacer khaw-sare' a primitive root; to lack; by implication, to fail, want, lessen:--be abated, bereave, decrease, (cause to) fail, (have) lack, make lower, want.
02648\ 2648 chaphaz khaw-faz' a primitive root; properly, to start up suddenly, i.e. (by implication) to hasten away, to fear:--(make) haste (away), tremble.
02651\ 2651 chophen kho'-fen from an unused root of uncertain signification; a fist (only in the dual):--fists, (both) hands, hand(-ful).

02654\ 2654 chaphets khaw-fates' a primitive root; properly, to incline to; by implication (literally but rarely) to bend; figuratively, to be pleased with, desire:--X any at all, (have, take) delight, desire, favour, like, move, be (well) pleased, have pleasure, will, would.
seek; causatively, to conceal oneself (i.e. let be sought), or mask:--change, (make) diligent (search), disquise self, hide, search (for, out).
02666\ 2666 chaphash khaw-fash' a primitive root; to spread loose; figuratively, to manumit:--be free.

02672\ 2672 chatsab khaw-tsab' or chatseb {khaw-tsabe'}; a primitive root ; to cut or carve (wood), stone or other material); by implication, to hew, split, square, quarry, engrave:--cut, dig, divide, grave, hew (out, -er), made, mason.
02683\ 2683 chetsen khay'-tsen from an unused root meaning to hold firmly; the bosom (as comprised between the arms):--bosom.
02685\ 2685 chatsaph khats-af' (Aramaic) a primitive root; properly, to shear or cut close; figuratively, to be severe:--hasty, be urgent.
02707\ 2707 chaqah khaw-kaw' a primitive root; to carve; by implication, to delineate; also to entrench:--carved work, portrayed, set a print.
02709\ 2709 Chaquwpha' khah-oo-faw' from an unused root probably meaning to bend; crooked; Chakupha, one of the Nethinim:--Hakupha.
